Technique: HIGH RELIEF; CARVED; ENGRAVED; HIGH RELIEF
Name: Stela of In-yotef
Description: The stela is framed on three sides by a torus moulding and crowned at the top by a cavetto cornice with a motif in relief. Inscriptions and scenes have been carved without inner details. Underneath two horizontal rows of text, a couple is sitting on a chair. On the right is an offering table with offerings on it. Below, near the feet of the couple, two men and two women are depicted, squatting, with accompanying texts. There are three further registers with six sitting or squatting figures with inscriptions.
